page.title: 02HOUSING
page.content: The chief building material of houses on the Main Street is black whinstone. They are between 150 and 200 years old. Most are double storey, three windows over two and are joined to give a long terraced formation. Two council housing schemes have been built since 1940's. They are all double storey blocks of two houses and have harled wall exteriors. Most are rented out but a few have been purchased by the occupiers. There are eight pensioner houses. With little private land to develop only one modern bungalow has been built in the last ten years. Three more have just been begun.
